result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Eric M. Wroblewski was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
*Pay fine 
*Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan. Payment plan enrollments are in person on Monday of each week.
*Bond to be applied against fine/costs

*Pay Blood Draw Fee
*If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
*Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
*DOT Assessment and comply with any recommendations of a safety plan (BAC: .242)

*Maintain absolute sobriety
*Provide DNA Sample 
*Comply with any other recommendations found appropriate by the agent

timeConds.notes:
*Sentence to commence within 60 days 
*May be served on home monitoring

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Eric M. Wroblewski in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

11:29 AM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

Court has a  Plea questionnaire/Agreement that was signed by Defendant today.

Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Defendant will plead to Count 1. Count 2 would be dismissed. Count 3 would be dismissed and read in.
Parties are ready  to proceed without a PSI.

Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Atty McFarland is prepared to proceed to sentencing.

Defendant enters a plea of: COUNT 1: NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney McFarland for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: Found GUILTY
Count 2: Dismissed
Count 3: Dismissed and Read In

Atty Knaapen addresses the Court.

Court addresses Defendant regarding consequences following a felony conviction, as to deportation, firearms and voting.
Atty McFarland stipulates that this is a 4th offense OWI.

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty McFarland makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

Court addresses the parties, believes the recommendations are appropriate.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1:
Determinate Prison Sentence for a period of 4 Years, Imposed and Stayed
2 Years Initial Confinement
2 Years Extended Supervision
Probation for 24 Months
Conditions:
Serve 180 days jail
Jail credit for 1 day
Sentence to commence within 60 days
May be served on home monitoring
Pay fine and costs totaling $3,264
Pay blood draw fee of $26.45
60 days to pay or set up payment plan
Bond to be applied against the fine/costs
36 Month DL Revocation
36 Month IID 
DOT Assessment and comply with any recommendations of a safety plan (BAC: .242)
Maintain absolute sobriety
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment
Provide DNA Sample (surcharge is already included in the fine/costs)
Maintain full time employment
Comply with any other recommendations found appropriate by the agent

State files information.

Atty McFarland received a copy of the information.

Court informs Defendant of charges and penalties.

Defendant waives reading of information.

Atty McFarland enters NOT GUILTY pleas.

BY THE COURT:
Bond is continued.

Atty Knaapen addresses the Court, PAC citation was written after test result returned.  Citation was set for Sept 14th at 9 am.

BY THE COURT:
Court quashes initial appearance date of September 14th at 9 am.

This citation is charged in this information. Citation number is T307331-3.

Defendant Eric M. Wroblewski in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

3:45 PM Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.

Parties are ready to proceed.

3:46 PM Jeremy Mueller is called and sworn in, police officer with Stevens Point Police Department.
Direct examination by Atty Knaapen.
Witness identifies Defendant.
3:50 PM Defense has no questions.

State has no further witnesses.

Defense has no witness.

 Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Portage County Community Justice Program Court Referral Form

Defendant Eric M. Wroblewski in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.

Court enters NOT GUILTY plea to Count 2. 

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

$1,500 cash bond:   Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.  Participate in the Portage County Pre-Trial Supervision Program and comply with the requirements for reporting, assessment, and programming.

To be heard at 1:15 p.m. today.

  ADA Cousins appears in Court.

BTC: $1,500 cash bond:   Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.  Participate in the Portage County Pre-Trial Supervision Program and comply with the requirements for reporting, assessment, and programming.
